item.title: Ghostwriters, polo shirts, and the fall of a landmark pesticide study
item.description: A flagship study that declared the weedkiller Roundup posed no serious health risks has been retracted with little fanfare, ending a 25-year saga that exposed how corporate interests can distort scientific research and influence government decision-making.

item.title: Georgia Power says it needs a huge increase in power capacity to meet data center demand
item.description: With data centers flooding into Georgia, utility regulators face a big decision: Should they let Georgia Power Co. spend more than $15 billion to increase its electricity capacity by 50% over the next six years to serve computer complexes? Or could the utility overbuild and stick other ratepayers with the bill?
